title: UFA V forum - Fallout theme
content:
"Fallout is a series of post-apocalyptic role-playing video games and later action role-playing games created by Interplay Entertainment. The series is set during the 21st, 22nd and 23rd centuries, and its atompunk retrofuturistic setting and art work are influenced by the post-war culture of 1950s United States, with its combination of hope for the promises of technology and the lurking fear of nuclear annihilation. A forerunner of Fallout is Wasteland, a 1988 game developed by Interplay Productions to which the series is regarded as a spiritual successor." - wikipedia.org

Software: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Visual Studio Code, Denwer, Proboards tools

working process

Create signature and icons (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop)

Create "header" for forum page (Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop)

Create prototype "header" for forum page. Coding: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP (Visual Studio Code, Denwer)

"Humanity is so resilient, to cling to life despite all of this"

- Fallout (video game)

final result

Home page (music player, navigation, autorisation, date & time, news and other components)

Other pages (profile, search, calendar, messages and other)

title: Theatre ATX
titlettemple: Web design, web developed, restyle logo and other
content:
"Theatre ATX (Academy of Theater Arts) - was founded in Russia, Saratov City on November 20, 1988. The first (and only) president (artistic director) of the "Academy" Ivan Ivanovich Verkhovykh, a graduate of the acting department of the I.A. Slonov and the directing department of the Higher Theater School named after B.V. Shchukin. While still an actor of the Saratov Youth Theater, he created three theater studios in Saratov, from which the theater arose over time: eight of the then studio members became a kind of core of the team." - Theatre ATX

Software: Denwer, Adobe Dreamweaver, Visual Studio Code, CMS Joomla, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop

working process

Restyle logo (convert to vector, color correction and add text)

"Свобода станет законом, а закон свободой. Ты вернешься и никогда не будешь рабом. ни ты, ни твои дети"

- И. Верховых (Theatre ATX)

final result

Home page (autorisation, navigation, slider, posters, news)

Other pages (photogallery, blog, about, contact)

* Photos are taken from the official website of Theatre ATX - theatre-atx.ru

title: planet of lightning - intro video
titlettemple: Intro video for Youtube and other performance
content:
Software: Blender, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop

Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect. So stuff like font loader and location (for route change). Anything that is lazyloaded you can attach update() to it so that it run once the component is rendered.

I've made an update using useRef to ensure we mount and demount the one and only instance of Locomotive Scroll we need + it let us removes useState which is not perf in our case. I also added a resize-observer to watch height modifications and update the scroll as @mxmtsk suggested

working process

Frame-by-frame script for intro video (Adobe Photoshop)

Process of work (Adobe After Effects)

Process of work (Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro)

"Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect."

final result

title: Shut up & game
titlettemple: Logo and poster for Youtube channel
content:
React Hook useEffect contains a call to 'setImgs'. Without a list of dependencies, this can lead to an infinite chain of updates. To fix this, pass [id] as a second argument to the useEffect Hook React Hook useEffect contains a call to 'setImgs'. Without a list of dependencies, this can lead to an infinite chain of updates. To fix this, pass [id] as a second argument to the useEffect Hook React Hook useEffect contains a call to 'setImgs'. Without a list of dependencies, this can lead to an infinite chain of updates. To fix this, pass [id] as a second argument to Curtains.js

Software: Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop

working process

title: Spheres - Nature elements
titlettemple: VR-360° video content for LED Media Spheres
content:
Target: Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect. So stuff like font loader and location (for route change). Anything that is lazyloaded you can attach update() to it so that it run once the component is rendered. I've made an update using useRef to ensure we mount and demount the one and only instance of Locomotive Scroll we need + it let us removes useState which is not perf in our case. I also added a resize-observer to watch height modifications and update the scroll as @mxmtsk suggested - https://github.com/locomotivemtl/locomotive-scroll/issues/13#issuecomment-774568954

Software: Blender, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop

working process

Create 3D spheres with procedural textures and geometry nodes technologies

Customer-approved options 3D spheres

Бизнес-центры / БЦ Земельный - БЦ Земельный

Render looped animation in VR 360° video format

Personally I just make sure that anything that impacts the height as a callback that I can feed into the instance useEffect.

final result
